info.title: Downloads API
info.description:
The Downloads API allows you to access and download installation and update files for available Tenable products. You can use the API endpoints to list product pages, list downloads available for a specific product, and to download a file. The endpoints can also be used to determine and download the latest version of a file to facilitate the automation of an installation.

**Note:** The Tenable Downloads API uses a different server URL than the Tenable.io API:

`https://www.tenable.com/downloads/api/v2/pages`.

### Authentication

Like the Downloads website, certain files require authentication to download. When files have a `"requires_auth": true` attribute on the product list page, the Downloads API uses bearer token authentication and requires a valid token in the Authorization header to download the file:
```
Authorization: Bearer AbCdEf123456
```

To access or reset your authentication token, navigate to the [Authentication Token](https://www.tenable.com/downloads/api_docs) page.

Examples of product downloads that **do not** require authentication include Nessus and Nessus Agents.

get.description: Returns a list of product pages.

200.description: Returned if the list of product pages is retrieved successfully.

value.title: Nessus
value.description: Binary download files for Nessus Professional, Nessus Manager, and connecting Nessus Scanners to Tenable.io & Tenable.sc.

500.description: Returned if an internal error occurred while processing the request.

get.summary: List downloadable files for a product
get.description: Returns a JSON hash of all download files for a given product page.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The product page slug; for example, `nessus`.

200.description: Returned if the list of downloadable files for the specified product was retrieved successfully.

404.description: Returned if the specified page cannot be found.

500.description: Returned if an internal error occurred while processing the request.

get.description:
Downloads a requested file.

**Note:** Some files require an authentication token to download.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The product page slug; for example, `nessus`.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The name of the file; for example, `Nessus-latest-x64.msi`.

200.description: Returned if the requested file is successfully retrieved.

401.description: Returned if a file requires authentication to download and the token is missing or invalid.

404.description: Returned if the specified file cannot be found.

500.description: Returned if an internal error occurred while processing the request.

description.example: Binary download files for Nessus Professional, Nessus Manager, and connecting Nessus Scanners to Tenable.io & Tenable.sc.

files_index_url.description: The URL to list the product files available for download.

file.description: The name of the file available for download.

size.description: The size of the file in bytes.

release_date.description: The date the file was built. This date is only used for internal tracking.

product_release_date.description: The date the product version and file was publicly released.

md5.description: The MD5 hash of the file.

sha256.description: The SHA256 hash of the file.

file_url.description: The URL to download the file.

requires_auth.description: Indicates whether or not the file requires a bearer authentication token to download.

file.description: The name of the file available for download.

size.description: The size of the file in bytes.

release_date.description: The date the file was built. This date is only used for internal tracking.

product_release_date.description: The date the product version and file was publicly released.

md5.description: The MD5 hash of the file.

sha256.description: The SHA256 hash of the file.

file_url.description: The URL to download the latest version of this file.

requires_auth.description: Indicates whether or not the file requires a bearer authentication token to download.

size.description: The size of the file in bytes.

md5.description: The MD5 hash of the file.

sha256.description: The SHA256 hash of the file.

file_url.description: The URL to download the file.

requires_auth.description: Indicates whether or not the file requires a bearer authentication token to download.

success.description: Indicates whether the server successfully found the requested item or not.

statusCode.description: The HTTP response status code of request.

error.description: The error that corresponds to the HTTP response status code.

correlationId.description: The correlation ID of the request.

traceId.description: The trace ID of the request.

rayId.description: The ray ID of the request.

error.description: The error that corresponds to the HTTP response status code.

correlationId.description: The correlation ID of the request.

traceId.description: The trace ID of the request.
